```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)

# Libraries
library(tidyverse)
library(dplyr)
library(here)
```

```{r}
# Load data
educ_spending <- read.csv(here("raw-data","k12_educ_realperch.csv")) %>%
  filter(state != "District of Columbia")
names(educ_spending) <- sub("^X", "", names(educ_spending))

governor <- read.csv(here("raw-data","governors_ballotpedia.csv")) %>%
  rename("state" = "X")
names(governor) <- sub("^X", "", names(governor))

house <- read.csv(here("raw-data","houses_ballotpedia.csv")) %>%
  rename("state" = "X")
names(house) <- sub("^X", "", names(house))

senate <- read.csv(here("raw-data","senates_ballotpedia.csv")) %>%
  rename("state" = "X")
names(senate) <- sub("^X", "", names(senate))
```

```{r}
# Pivot_longer
educ_longer <- educ_spending %>%
  pivot_longer(
    !state,
    names_to = "year",
    values_to = "educ_spending"
  )

governor_longer <- governor %>%
  pivot_longer(
    !state,
    names_to = "year",
    values_to = "governor"
  )

house_longer <- house %>%
  pivot_longer(
    !state,
    names_to = "year",
    values_to = "house"
  )

senate_longer <- senate %>%
  pivot_longer(
    !state,
    names_to = "year",
    values_to = "senate"
  )

# Joining
data_pre <- educ_longer %>%
  inner_join(governor_longer,
             by = c("state", "year")) %>%
  inner_join(house_longer,
             by = c("state", "year")) %>%
  inner_join(senate_longer,
             by = c("state", "year"))

# Numeric-ify party: -1 = Dem, 0 = split, 1 = Rep (nebraska gets N/A for now)
data <- data_pre %>%
  mutate(
    governor = case_when(
      governor == "R" ~ -1,
      governor == "O" ~ 0,
      governor == "D" ~ 1,
      TRUE ~ NA
    ),
    senate = case_when(
      senate == "R" ~ -1,
      senate == "S" ~ 0,
      senate == "D" ~ 1,
      TRUE ~ NA
    ),
    house = case_when(
      house == "R" ~ -1,
      house == "S" ~ 0,
      house == "D" ~ 1,
      TRUE ~ NA
    ),
  )
```

```{r}
data
```

### Changing state to its abbreviations
```{r}
# Vector of state names and abbreviations
state_abbreviations <- setNames(state.abb, state.name)

# Assuming your DataFrame is named something like `edu_df`
data <- data %>%
  # Step 1: Convert state names to abbreviations
  mutate(state = state_abbreviations[state]) 

data
```

```{r}
names(data)[names(data) == "state"] <- "State"
names(data)[names(data) == "year"] <- "Year"
data
```
